main event: On 5 February 1949, an observer reported seeing an intense white light followed by a reddish yellow light, followed by an object that appeared to drop molten drops from its rear while driving south of Parkersburg, West Virginia.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 4 inches in diameter, Observation lasted for 15-20 seconds, The object emitted an intense white light that changed to reddish yellow, The witness believed the object was a meteor or a mechanical device, No photographs were included in the document, but sketches were mentioned.
sighted object: Comet-like ball or mass of sparks emitting molten drops
witness description: The witness was driving and described the object while feeling that it had a mechanical element.
